titleStmt.title: The life of that incomparable man, Faustus Socinus Senensis, described by a Polonian knight. Whereunto is added an excellent discourse, which the same author would have had premised to the works of Socinus; together with a catalogue of those works.
Vita Fausti Socini Senensis. English
titleStmt.author: Przypkowski, Samuel, 1592-1670.
Biddle, John, 1615-1662.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Moone, at the seven Stars in Pauls Church-yard, neer the great north-doore.,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Vita Fausti Socini Senensis.
Translator's note "To the reader" signed: J.B., i.e. John Biddle.
The first leaf and the last leaf bear printer's mark.
"An excellent discourse which the same Polonian knight would have had premised to the works of Socinus" has separate dated title page; register and pagination are continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
